etymology.description: semantic 木(木) (mù, "tree; wood") + phonetic 登(登) (dēng, "ascend") = a fruit from a tree -> orange
etymology.interpretation: The character 橙(chéng) combines 木(mù, 'tree') to signify the material nature, with 登(dēng) as the phonetic element. This illustrates that oranges come from trees.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃橙(我喜歡吃橙)。
橙子富含维生素C(橙子富含維生素C)，对健康有益(對健康有益)。
examples.pinyin: Chéngzi fùhán wéishēngsù C, duì jiànkāng yǒuyì.
examples.english: Oranges are rich in vitamin C, which is beneficial for health.
